Reviews.Title: “Average in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Aidan T
Reviews.Content: Having read the trip advisor reviews I was looking forward to my stay,however I was very disappointed with the room itself. The room no was 105 it is extremely small with was one side of the bed pushed against the wall therefore there was nowhere to place either a cup , glass or even a book aside from the fact you need to crawl up and down the bed to get in or out.there is also only one chair in the room despite it being classed as a double room. There is very little storage place not even a drawer.The bathroom was clean and adequate. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the location great.Be prepared to pay for the Pringles and nuts left out on display they unlike the coffee are not complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, ok location, hard bed with scratchy sheets.”
Reviews.Author: MRW82
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, not extravagant, not dirty. We only spent time there to sleep and shower. While the bathrooms are large enough, the room was small even for Paris. That can be overlooked however it had very firm bed and low quality scratchy sheets. We did not eat at the restaurant but the service was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Dcc84
Reviews.Content: A superb hotel with very helpful and pleasant staff who couldn't be friendlier and spoke perfect English!! The location of the hotel is fantasic a short 2 minute walk to a main metro line which is 2 stops from the arc de triomphe and connects to sever other lines. The arc de triomphe and champs eleese is a 10-15 minute walk away and a pleasant walk at that!! Located in a nice area this is a fantastic choice if ur looking for a reasonably priced hotel and is definitely value for money!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone goin to Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place and good location!”
Reviews.Author: Thy74
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel, which definitely exceeds expectations. We were received by an extremely friendly person at the front desk who spoke English and was careful to explain to us each and every item that was free/not free to us, which I thought was really helpful. About a 5 minute walk to the nearest metro. Also a 5 minute walk to the stop where the airport shuttle drops and picks up passengers. We were also able to walk to all the attractions, including Notre Dame. The room we were given was clean, and a decent size by Paris standards. We really enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: del1205
Reviews.Content: We wanted a reasonably priced, simple, comfortable, hotel in a safe location that was close enough to all of Paris's attractions. This hotel was just that. The staff were friendly, our room was a good size (401) it had everything we needed in it. We were able to walk to everywhere in Paris but it was close to the metro as well. Lovely restaurants around too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: patriciageraldes11
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and comfortable, staff was also nice. I stayed from Monday to Friday for work and paid 150€ per night with no breakfast included (this is a three star hotel). All I need to eat in the morning is a cup of coffee and a piece of bread or croissant, and I asked if I was able to have this included in the price. The hotel refused. It was the hassle to have to get out earlier to go and eat before work. It would have been nice to be able to have the coffee in the Hotel. Just a small detail that could have made a big difference for me and almost no cost for the Hotel. It was good to have a computer available to guests in the lobby with printing facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, comfortable rooms, decent price”
Reviews.Author: TMSMonterrey_Mexico
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on two separate nights as a "last resort", since the group hotel where we were to have stayed didn't have rooms for a full 4-night stay. I assumed it would be a typical European hotel but was pleasantly surprised, especially for Paris. The hotel is small, make no mistake. If you're used to chain hotels, large rooms, etc. then you won't like it. But we found it to be cozy, modern and apparently recently renovated, everything worked and most important, the beds were comfy and the bathrooms fully functional and modern. The hotel has 5 or 6 floors but there is an elevator so it's not a walk-up. The service personnel were excellent. We could communicate easily in English and Spanish (and a few words of French that we knew), and they went out of their way to help in every way. Smiles, suggestions, and an attitude that denies the French "rudeness" that stereotypes them. The breakfast buffet is well layed out with all the typical fare, even eggs, bacon and sausage for the American/British appetite. The breakfast room is an honor bar in the afternoon/evening, where you serve yourself and let them know what you consumed at checkout. Room 101 was perfect, again pointing out that they are small European hotel rooms and not chain hotel layouts. Room 202 was a bit smaller and awkward but still comfortable. We paid 220 euro/night with breakfast included (mid-Sept. 2011) and it was well worth it. The other 2 nights of our stay were at the Concorde Lafayette just half a block away, a large hotel adjacent to the convention center, and it was horrible by comparison. If we go back, we will surely visit here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, and safe hotel”
Reviews.Author: g_whitloc
Reviews.Content: Nice location and safe hotel. Staff was helpful and they were friendly too. The metro is close and the Air France drop is close to the hotel as well. Small rooms like most Paris hotels. The honor bar is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - clean, excellent staff and well located.”
Reviews.Author: myholiday77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a two night break to Paris. The hotel is ideally located to the Air France Bus Stop and the main attractions of Paris. There are some very nice restaurants on the street where the hotel is. I Staff are very helpful and friendly and the rooms are clean and comfortable. Despite the street being busy, I didn't have any problems with noise. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Anthony M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice (not excellent, but at the low price we paid, we didn't expect too much). It's in a great location, 10 minutes from champs elysees/arc de trimphe. The area is nice, and we always felt safe there. The staff were friendly, and most spoke very good english (I can speak french a little, but it's limited). There was complimentary tea and coffee every day in the lobby from 1pm-6pm, but the room came complete with kettle and tea and coffee anyway. The room was clean, if a little small (but not surprising for what we paid, and this great location in Paris). There was always a nice atmosphere in the hotel, and staff were always ready to help. It was also very close to one of the stops for the bus from CDG airport (porte Maillot), which was very helpful to us. No complaints really, and the only thing that could have made this better would have been a larger room, with a bath in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: cretangal
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at a nearby hotel which unfortunately was booked out. I paid just under £200 for a night and truthfully, I didn't think it was worth it. Neither my friend nor I slept a wink. I asked for a twin beds but what I got was a strange configuration. A single bed placed right at the foot of the double bed right in a tiny room. The bathroom was the same size as the bedroom. They could do with a bigger bedroom and halve the size of the bathroom. The pillows were so soft that they sank right down when used. The loud thumping music outside thankfully subsided by 1am. BTW, they will not give the password to their wi-fi over the phone. You'll have to present yourself at the reception to get a print out receipt. First time I've ever had to do this. The service was a little curt at the best of times. A friendly smile goes a long way.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ksturni
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the hotel in May and it was delightful. The room was clean and had everything we needed and the breakfast was delicious.The hotel staff were so nice and helpful which made our stay in Paris even better.We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but decor straight from the early 80's”
Reviews.Author: AnnalisaG
Reviews.Content: I go to Paris for work very often and I have to say that hotels in Paris are extortionately expensive and normally pretty awful. La Villa des Ternes is expensive for a 3 star and painfully average however, considering the general level of price-quality ratio, it is acceptable. The decor is straight from the early 80's, think oranges and deep reds and the room felt quite depressing. However the en-suite was rather big and very clean. Breakfast buffet is good and I had a decent night sleep, the hotel is right next door to a couple of nice restaurant which I found quite convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful. Attentive service, lovely rooms, charming staff.”
Reviews.Author: hollyg2
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at this jewel of a find near the Palais du Congres (sp?). Metro stop not even a two minute walk away. 15 minute walk to the Arc du Triomphe. 30 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. Great restaurants nearby. 3 blocks to groceries, convenience store across the street. Housekeeping was immaculate. Front desk super helpful. They have an honour bar (we never used, but they have a lovely tea room/breakfast area that guests are welcome to enjoy). Free wifi. Beds were hard and pillows were flat - but on par with any other European hotel I've ever stayed at, just not the same as North American hotels in the same price range. Room was tiny, with two very small double beds, but the first room we checked in to had a very small double, and they moved us with no charge to a nicer room on a higher floor. We had a beautiful view of the street with windows that swung in with a little rail so you could lean over it - very much exactly what I thought Paris should be like!!!! My eleven year old loved it, it was perfect for us. We actually spent a day in the hotel doing nothing after a couple of days of sightseeing, and it was wonderful. We had a tv that we never turned on, a safe, a closet. And the bathroom was bliss - big tub, nice new fixtures, delightful toiletries. The lights in the hotel are all on motion detectors, which was kind of creepy. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would stay there again. We didn't eat the breakfast - it wasn't expensive compared to restaurants in the neighbourhood, but there were so many little cafes and bakeries to explore that we normally dined out or picnicked. There are great parks on Periere a few blocks away, lots of green space. A perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Prince0fGonville
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at Villa des Ternes rather than the enormous tower at the conference centre nearby. Villa des Ternes was friendly, comfortable and fine for business travel. The room was a bit small but OK for a solo traveler. The cooked breakfast was good. I would probably stay in the same hotel again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Great beds, awesome location, albeit on the small side”
Reviews.Author: Bluewolfmoon07
Reviews.Content: I come to Paris 6 or 7 times a year and this is by far the nicest Parisian style hotel I've stayed in so far. In the lovely central Porte Maillot district it is a short walk from the Metro and great shopping. The rooms are smaller than they seem in the photo's but as a single traveller I don't spend much time in my room. As a couple, the placement of the bed against one wall would make it difficult for both people to get out easily. The staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel is one of the quieter ones in terms of shutting out the traffic noise of the busy street below. Once again on location - there are a myriad of great restaurants in the area making this a perfect hotel for any stay

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and nice.”
Reviews.Author: traveladdicted60
Reviews.Content: This smaller hotel is very conveniently located. The room was very clean, with a nice desk and a flat screen tv. I couldn''t try the free wifi because my computer was down but used the computer downstairs, which is also free of charge for customers. The bathroom was nice and modern, hotel personnel was very friendly and breakfast was plentiful (British/US style). The hotel is five walking minutes away from the Air France bus stop to go to the airport, which is the reason why I chose it. All in all, a very good small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Nirn
Reviews.Content: Excellent, reasonably priced hotel for Palais des Congres visitors. Location: The hotel is just 15 minutes walk to the Arc de Triumph (Etoile) and 5 mintutes from the Port Maillot metro / RER station. The Air France Bus from Charles De Gaull airport drops you 2 minutes walk from the hotel, so no cab is necessary. Rooms: Rooms are small but clean and comfort. Wireless internet is free along with a free computer to use the lobbly. Reasonable breakfast for 15 Euro. Hotel staff is helpful and partient. Restaurants: Many good restaurants within a short walking distance. Try Le Sud or Le Ballon des Ternes for lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: duesy
Reviews.Content: La Villa des Ternes is small hotel with good service and nice clean rooms in a central location of Paris for an affordable price by Parisian standards. A much appreciated extra was the free use of the internet in the comfy lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Very homely hotel but with small rooms and not the best of locations”
Reviews.Author: Moneyticketspassport
Reviews.Content: The position of the hotel is ok. It is only 10 - 15 mins walk to the Arc de Triomphe and around 20 - 30 mins to the Eiffel Tower. However, with hindsight, we would have preferred to be a bit more central, as many of the sights are really too far to walk to from this hotel, although it is fairly quick and easy to get around using the metro. The hotel really is very homely. Reception staff were very welcoming and friendly. Complimentary tea and coffee is provided throughout the afternoon, and there is an honesty bar, which initially seemed expensive but which was actually reasonable per Paris prices. You just help yourself to drinks, then leave a tab at reception. The small lounge and reception area are really cosy. The rooms are on the small side, with the double bed being against a wall - space was that short. But, it was clean and adequate. Bit noisy as our room overlooked the side-street, but not too much of a problem as we were exhausted after sightseeing all day! The shower was good, but the way the shower door opened, part-way along on hinges, meant that if you were a bit chubby, you would have real problems getting in and out! I would recommend this hotel, but only to my slimmer friends who are happy to either walk, walk, walk or who wish to become intimately acquainted with the Paris metro system. It is a very nice 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This was a very nice clean comfortable friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bazlincoln
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice clean comfortable friendly Hotel, Handy for the 43 Bus from Gare du Nord station. We will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Conveinient , affordable hotel ,well situated to see the highlights of Paris”
Reviews.Author: 2chilidog
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. Affordable, Not fancy but clean, good location, near metro. Walkable to Arc Triumph, Eiffel Tower. NEar to large shopping mall, IRish Pub, many shops. Rooms clean, modern shower stalls, breakfast available at cost in lobby, free honor bar in lounge, free coffee in afternoon. Staff very accomodating, pleasant and speak very good English. Beds comfy. Coffee/Tea in room. Lower floor a bit noisy ouside window but did not last for long period. No Pool

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Trevorcarter2001
Reviews.Content: A great taste of Paris, close to the L'arc de triomph. Welcoming bi-lingual staff on a direct bus route to Gare du Nord station. Good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star hotel. Ideal location near bus departure to CDG.”
Reviews.Author: YVR111
Reviews.Content: Godd reception. Pleasant lounge area with honor bar (in Paris!!!!). Room small but very clean and quiet even on the street side with double windows. Bathroom modern by french standards with quirky shower. Overall a good hotel with "in line" prices for Paris. Well positioned for taking the Air France shuttle to CDG.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem !”
Reviews.Author: markn002
Reviews.Content: The first thing I would have to say about this hotel is that although it is on the outskirts of Paris, Paris is a very small city, and so it does not take you long to get to the centre - e.g. a 5-minute walk to the nearest Metro, and then 2 stops (about 2 mins !) to the Arc de Triomphe !! We found this hotel to be a little gem - there are plenty of cheap and nasty hotels in Paris, but this was a delightful place to stay. All the staff were very friendly, the lobby was nice and inviting, the rooms were well decorated (although not enormous), there was free Wi-fi, TV, coffee making facilities and the bathroom was also well decorated. Each room also had safe and a mini bar (excellent !) and my favourite feature of the hotel was that there was an honesty bar downstairs where you served yourselves drinks and noted them down to give to reception - how lovely and trusting ! Also in this room (where the excellent buffet breakfasts are served) were some board games, so we also enjoyed a game of Scrabble each night too ! The hotel is also near plenty of restaurants, so there is no shortage of places to eat in the evening, and also near a large UGC cinema. All in all, a very pleasant stay, and we'd certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice and friendly small familiar hotel at the right place in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: SwedenDoc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at La Villa des Ternes during a congress in Paris. Just two minutes walk from the Congress centre where you also can find the subway. The service was excellent and the staff was really helpful. The room was nice, however small, but clean, with everything you need at hand. The surroundings had some good restaurants and shops, and if you have good shoes it’s a nice walk to the centre of Paris and other sights.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location for Place de Congres!”
Reviews.Author: ArHana
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean room, with comfy bed and pillows! We got a nice room overlooking the street and cute french terraces. Room was kept clean all 5 days we were there. Great location for the conference centre [3 mins walk] and close to Porte Maillot metro [5mins walk] to explore the rest of Paris. Toiletries were provided,which was nice and room had small fridge-convenient! Nice cafe 2 mins on the right of hotel. We really liked the room and location. Didnt try breakfast tho since it was too expensive at EURO 13 per person.Didnt stay in hotel much since there's so much to explore in Paris, so didnt check out any hotel amenities [dont think they had much of that tho,only saw a bar] recommended for conference go-ers :)

Reviews.Title: “Poor service for business”
Reviews.Author: Lolenon
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel, probably offering good value for leisure travelers. But it is not prepared for business customers: 1) The internet connection did not work and the receptionist could not resolve my problem. 2) There was just one, very poor quality and dirty iron and ironing board for the whole hotel. Whenever I wanted to iron my shirt, I had to call the receptionist desk and wait for a few minutes for somebody to bring the iron - sometimes I had to call twice... 3) The room was equipped with a simple phone without a speaker function which do not allow me to carry out a proper teleconference - I had to hold the phone throughout hour-long teleconferences. This is surprising given that it is located very near the largest congress centre in Paris (where I attended the conference while staying at the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: hanadrew
Reviews.Content: i was looking to book a week in paris as a 1st yr anniversary present for my wife so wanted something which was central to the sights, had a bit of character, and was cheap without being tacky. i was very impressed with this hotel. location: 5 min walk from porte maillot metro station, 10min walk to the arc de triumph. couple of restaurant / cafe near by, atm nearby staff: spoke very good english. i tried my best to speak french (not very good admittedly) and they were very accomodating room: not the biggest, but more than ample. double bed, 2 desks, private bathroom etc... my only gripe was there were no tea / coffee facilities in the room services: breakfast was extra at €13 - a bit steep so didnt try it. they have a courtesy bar and coffe facilities which seemed to be free?! in the lobby - they also had board games in the lobby which came in handy as the only english chanels on the tv were cnn and bbc world news - hardly exciting! the room did have free wifi overall id give this an 8 out of 10 pros - see above cons - no coffee in room, no convenience store nearby (eating out in paris is VERY expensive)

Reviews.Title: “Romantic trip with my life lover”
Reviews.Author: DianaDMN
Reviews.Content: It was the 3rd time trip to Paris, but the most romantic and in love one. The hotel was one of the reason for the romantic atmosphere. Even if the room was small (like any other hotel room in Paris), we were very pleased by the cleaning services, the welcoming staff, and the high standard of the rooms. The hotel was also very close to the Arc deTriomphe, and to the bus station. Well done to the staff of the hotel! Diana & Catalin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: STL_tourguide
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at La Villa des Ternes. Excellent front desk service. Rooms always clean and made up nightly. A nice tip is that the hotel is only 100 yards from the Air France bus stop for convenient connection to CDG.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: SKINewcastle
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of its proximity to Palais des Congress. We have stayed at other hotels on our visits to Paris but will never stay anywhere else other than this Hotel. All staff were outstanding and the front desk service was exceptional - nothing was too much trouble. The room was comfortable - not large but this is Paris. We found its location very convenient, fabulous restaurants, dry cleaners and supermarket close by with added advantage Airport bus just around the corner. Although we had one hiccup, arriving 9.45am for breakfast we were told no more hot food, we would rate this Hotel 5/5.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: gmast
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days in Paris at this hotel and we really enjoyed it. The room was very comfortable and spacious. The bathroom was clean and had a good size. The location is really good (specially in you are flying with Ryanair, the bus that goes to the beauvois is very close), some blocks away from Champ-Elisees. I would stay again there if I go to Paris. Tips: While you are in Paris check out "Les gourmet des Ternes". It's very close to this hotel and the food is mouthwatering. It is expensive but worthy

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good service, competitive rates.”
Reviews.Author: OrchardSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, near metro and lots of restaurants. Very competitive prices for the services offerered.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, big service”
Reviews.Author: RaveDJ
Reviews.Content: I can't begin to praise this hotel enough. Everyone from night porter to cleaner was friendly, and the whole experience was excellent. The hotel has been recently renovated (to a high standard) from top to bottom, with wood in abundance. Very tasteful, although they could have opened the front for al fresco relaxation. The room, while compact, had what we needed: hanging space, small fridge, safe, flatscreen TV, quiet AC, hairdryer. Anyone staying for a week would easily cope. The ensuite bathroom had a fullsize bath with a shower over. I'm a big guy who often struggles in small cubicles so this was a welcome inclusion. The beds were comfortable and seemed spotlessly clean. Downstairs, they operate an honesty bar: help yourself (up to 2am) and hand your record over at the permanently-manned reception afterwards. Choice is slightly limited: 2 Cokes and 2 bottled beers cost €19. Next door and just around the corner, there are several restaurants, with French and Belgian cuisine prevalent. Not cheap but nothing is in Paris. The building work mentioned elsewhere seems to have finished. I highly recommend this hotel if you don't need to be right in the centre. Saying that, it's merely 5 minutes walk to the M1 and RER, and only a further 10 to the heart of the city. As a footnote, I foolishly left my house keys in the room. I called the following day and the receptionist found them within minutes and couriered them to me in Germany. I am very grateful for this extra sparkle - the icing on a lovely cake.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, service in central neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: paulatravel
Reviews.Content: Just like its big (and pricier) sister, the Lenox in Montparnasse, the Villa des Ternes offers spotless and comfortable, if not simple, rooms. The service, unlike that in many Paris hotels, is personal and welcoming. I cannot agree with earlier comments regarding closet space, which is perfectly adequate, unless, of course, one is moving or on a long journey with lots of luggage. Work has been taking place across the street on another addition to this chain of quality hotels, but during my stay in a room directly across from the site, I was not disturbed by any noise. It appears that the new hotel will be opening at the end of the year, and for those curious to get a taste of the new offering, a showroom in the Villa des Ternes is available to guests (at a higher rate nevertheless). Definately a great find on the generally pricey Paris hotel scene, in a convenient location for transport around town.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowPopy
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a very well-placed hotel with friendly staff and an extremely comfortable bed -pick this one. Yes, the rooms are small. Yes, there was no wardrobe to hang up clothes . My sister and I were on a 2 day trip to Paris-very little luggage and in no need of full hotel facilities and the Villa des Tenes was perfect. All the more so , as the pick up point for the Ryanair bus was 5 minutes away. Cannot compliment the staff enough. They looked after our bags all day and when we went back a wee bit early to wait for the bus , we were offered free refreshments from the bar, Booked it with Expedia and it worked out at less than £90 for the room. Yes there was a bit of noise too from an adjacent building , where renovation was going on but , in Paris-who needs a long lie. Choose this hotel NOW.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service unfortunately”
Reviews.Author: ignacioEngland
Reviews.Content: I arrived on Monday evening and was checked-in by the male member of staff. He advised me of various things including a special offer in relation to the mini-bar. He said that for €6 (per day) I could have as many soft drinks as I wanted from the mini-bar. I don't normally touch mini-bars, however this sounded like a good offer so I went to my room, settled down and took a can of orange from the mini-bar. I also took at bottle of water and a can of coke and a couple of drinks the next morning before I left for work. I was staying for 2 nights but only used the mini bar that first day. On Wednesday morning I had decided to have breakfast and then checked out. I was somewhat concerned to note that all the individual items from the mini-bar were included on my bill (€5.20 for a can of coke!!!!). I explained to the female member of staff that I had taken up the €6 soft drinks offer that the member of staff checking me in had told me about. She said there was no such offer and that he worked in another hotel and it must be an offer there, but it was not valid here. Another member of staff appeared and said that this was not an offer at this hotel. I said that their member of staff had told me about this offer and they suggested that I should have looked at the tariff in my room and known that the offer was incorrect. I explained that I had not looked at any tariff because I had no intention of taking anything other than soft drinks, based upon this offer. They seemed uninterested in my explanation and I asked them to make sure that the member of staff in question stopped telling guests about this offer if the hotel would not be honouring it. They eventually offered to take off the charge for breakfast that morning, however I was left feeling that I had in some way inconvenienced them and that I was stupid for believing what their member of staff had brought to my attention. Although I had stayed in this hotel once before, and have no complaints about the quality of the rooms, I will think long and hard about whether I stay there again based purely upon this experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: HopScotchEurope
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights in Hotel La Villa des Ternes and I couldn't have been happier, I live in Germany and have been to Paris numerous times and from now on - this is where I will stay. Minutes (2 blocks) from a main RER and Metro stop, it has very easy access to all the main attractions in Paris, and is surrounded by nice cafes, an Irish Pub with a very friendly staff, FREE WIFI, and a market to pick up bread and cheese to enjoy on the lawn of the Eiffel Tower or in one of Paris' many parks (Luxembourg Gardens being my favorite!). The hotel is clean, shower is great, and bed is comfortable. Hotel room is SMALL - but they have a good amount of storage space which means the space that you do have is yours and you're not stepping over your bags. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. This hotel rates a perfect score - GREAT VALUE for price - clean, comfortable, modern rooms, great bathroom, friendly staff. With a three star you never know what you're going to get - Hotel La Villa des Ternes was a wonderful find. Rated "very good" for service and rooms only because it's not a "consierge" type hotel - the front desk staff was helpful and friendly - but you're not going to be booking tours, tickets, etc through them. Rooms were great for my taste, but rated down only because they were small - which really didn't bother me over all. Overall, Excellent hotel and if you're looking for a reasonable price and nice place to stay, this is your hotel. For business travellers - RIGHT across from the Concord Layfette and Meridian hotel. Perfect access to any conference there ~1 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fiona4037
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 day stay at this lovely hotel. I chose this hotel due to is location close to the Ryanair shuttle bus set down area and it was exactly that about a 2 minute walk. It also seemed great value for money by Paris standards (€600 for 5 nights, club room). The hotel itself was small but quiet modern, we chose the club room for our stay as it was meant to be bigger, the room itself was nicely decorated, big enough for a comfortable stay but definatley not huge. The bathroom was nice, clean with some good complimentary toiletries and the shower was fantastic, great pressure. The plasma tv with the english channels and the safe in the closet were a nice bonus. The area around the hotel is quiet but has lots of amenities. The road its located on has a FNAC store which was great for getting bargin tickets to Disneyland, there are also lots of good restaurants nearby, with a nice Irish bar (James Joyce) around the corner. we made use of a nice backery and mini-market down the road instead of paying the €15 for breakfast The hotel is also located near two metro stations which was great for making our way to all of Paris' attractions. its also located on one the Night bus lines which meant you never have any trouble getting home any time of the day or night. Over all a relaxing comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Spot - Great shower, great bed, weird chairs”
Reviews.Author: ottawa-resident
Reviews.Content: On a recent biz trip, this hotel worked out well. It's very close to the Palais for conferences etc. The place is well kept and the bed was awesome. Super firm, and I could have laid there for ever. Initially with just one sheet and one blanket, I was chilly, so asked for another blanket, which they provided. The next day they had substituted a big fluffy white duvet for all the above, and it was very nice. Unfortunately, I had a ridiculously nasty cold and needed bed whenever possible. I could have been much happier if there were a kettle or coffee maker in the room to get hot liquids into me, but I was miserable enough with my cold that I didn't figure out any other way to get hot tea. The shower is unusually modern and functional for Paris. There is the ubiquitous peeling wallpaper - What is it about Paris that wall paper never sticks anywhere, no matter how many stars your hotel has?! Breakfast was decent, though at 15€ typically pricey. The other nitpick is that the chairs in the breakfast room are bizarrely short, like they got a deal on a set of chairs that had 15cm cut off all the legs. Probably not great if you're older and have trouble bending down. The area has a good selection of restaurants (good seafood just next store). The staff was friendly and spoke enough English to get by, though thankfully let me work on my French. You can get an Air France bus to a spot just around the corner which saves you serious cash. For a tourist, it's not bad. A bit of a hike to the nearest metro, but I've had worse. Oh - and an iron was requestable, but not always available - another innovation European hotels could figure out. (That and wall paper glue).

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: backrower
Reviews.Content: Excellent medium sized hotel in a good location , a good base for exploring Paris with plenty of restaurants in the area. While the rooms are smallish, everything is spotlessly clean. Reception is manned 24/7 by most helpful staff. A very good breakfast with large choice is available for a supplement.We thought that this hotel was very good value for a short stay.
